main event: A bright, round object with an orange glow under its belly was observed for two to three seconds at a very high rate of speed, disappearing behind a mountain range.
interesting points: The object was observed at an altitude of approximately 5,000 feet.
The object was described as having an orangish tail about twenty times the diameter of the main body.
The object was seen by multiple observers, including a control tower operator at Peterson Field in Colorado Springs.
The sighting was initially classified as a possible balloon or aircraft, but the final conclusion was that it was a daytime meteor.
The report includes detailed information about the object's altitude, azimuth, and elevation during the sighting.
sighted object: a bright, round object with an orange glow
witnesses: multiple observers, including a control tower operator
photographs: no photographs present in the report
